unnormalised: ## Builder Reviews: Don't Get Nailed! (Before You Nail Down That Deal!)
normalised: ## Builder Reviews: Don't Get Nailed! (Before You Nail Down That Deal!)

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Buying a house is a HUGE deal, right? Almost as big as scoring tickets to a SRK movie premiere! And in India, where we value "ghar" (home) so much, choosing the right builder is absolutely critical. I mean, you don’t want your dream flat in Mumbai turning into a leaky nightmare during the monsoon, do you?
normalised: Hey everyone! Buying a house is a huge deal, right? Almost as big as scoring tickets to a S R K movie premiere! And in India, where we value "ghar" (home) so much, choosing the right builder is absolutely critical. I mean, you don’t want your dream flat in Mumbai turning into a leaky nightmare during the monsoon, do you?

unnormalised: That’s why builder reviews are your best friend! Think of them as your online charcha (discussion) with thousands of potential neighbours. They give you the real scoop, not just the sugar-coated promises in the glossy brochures.
normalised: That’s why builder reviews are your best friend! Think of them as your online charcha (discussion) with thousands of potential neighbours. They give you the real scoop, not just the sugar-coated promises in the glossy brochures.

unnormalised: I remember my cousin, Priya, almost booked a flat with "Sunshine Developers" in Bangalore based solely on their fancy website. Thankfully, she checked online reviews first and discovered a whole load of complaints about delayed possession – some dating back to 2021! Apparently, the completion date had been pushed back multiple times, and communication was non-existent. She dodged a bullet there!
normalised: I remember my cousin, Priya, almost booked a flat with "Sunshine Developers" in Bangalore based solely on their fancy website. Thankfully, she checked online reviews first and discovered a whole load of complaints about delayed possession – some dating back to two thousand twenty one! Apparently, the completion date had been pushed back multiple times, and communication was non-existent. She dodged a bullet there!

unnormalised: Things to look for in builder reviews:
normalised: Things to look for in builder reviews:

unnormalised: *   **Delivery delays:** Are they consistently delivering on time? Nobody wants to be stuck paying rent while waiting for their own place.
normalised: *   **Delivery delays:** Are they consistently delivering on time? Nobody wants to be stuck paying rent while waiting for their own place.

unnormalised: *   **Construction quality:** Are the materials used up to par? Are there reports of leaky roofs or cracked walls? Remember that neighbour's tale of water seepage, avoid it!
normalised: *   **Construction quality:** Are the materials used up to par? Are there reports of leaky roofs or cracked walls? Remember that neighbour's tale of water seepage, avoid it!

unnormalised: *   **Customer service:** Are they responsive to complaints and queries? Good customer service can make all the difference, especially post-possession. My friend Ravi had a horrific experience trying to get a minor plumbing issue fixed – it took him 6 months and countless phone calls!
normalised: *   **Customer service:** Are they responsive to complaints and queries? Good customer service can make all the difference, especially post-possession. My friend Ravi had a horrific experience trying to get a minor plumbing issue fixed – it took him six months and countless phone calls!

unnormalised: *   **Hidden costs:** Were there unexpected charges sprung on buyers at the last minute? Rs. 50,000 for "miscellaneous expenses" that nobody could explain? Avoid!
normalised: *   **Hidden costs:** Were there unexpected charges sprung on buyers at the last minute? Rupee fifty thousand for "miscellaneous expenses" that nobody could explain? Avoid!

unnormalised: Don't just rely on the builder's own website testimonials (duh!). Check out independent review sites and forums. Look for reviews from verified buyers. And remember, take everything with a pinch of salt. Some negative reviews might be from disgruntled competitors, or maybe someone just had a bad day. But a consistent pattern of negative feedback is definitely a red flag. Also keep in mind projects that have been delayed since say, 14/01/2020, should be checked with due diligence.
normalised: Don't just rely on the builder's own website testimonials (duh!). Check out independent review sites and forums. Look for reviews from verified buyers. And remember, take everything with a pinch of salt. Some negative reviews might be from disgruntled competitors, or maybe someone just had a bad day. But a consistent pattern of negative feedback is definitely a red flag. Also keep in mind projects that have been delayed since say, fourteenth january two thousand and twenty, should be checked with due diligence.

unnormalised: Finally, schedule a site visit. Talk to existing residents. Get a feel for the place yourself. Did they promise a sprawling park view? Make sure it's not just a glimpse between two upcoming buildings!
normalised: Finally, schedule a site visit. Talk to existing residents. Get a feel for the place yourself. Did they promise a sprawling park view? Make sure it's not just a glimpse between two upcoming buildings!

unnormalised: Remember, buying a house is a huge investment, so do your homework! Don't let some smooth-talking salesman convince you otherwise. Your future “ghar” (home) depends on it. Check those reviews, maybe around 06:00 pm after work? It will save you from a lot of headache later, maybe even Rs. 100000! Good luck, and happy house hunting! Also, check their project completion history since 15/08/1947.
